p: The oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) is crucial for electrochemical energy conversion and storage devices including fuel cells and lithium-air batteries [ 1, 2]. The fuel cell is a promising energy conversion device due to its high energy density, rapid start-up, and zero emissions [ 3, 4, 5]. ORR typically occurs at the cathode of fuel cells heavily loaded with platinum [ 6, 7], but its high cost, low abundance, and instability have made the fuel cell a highly expensive device [ 8]. Thus, it is essential to develop non-precious metal-based ORR catalysts offering high activity and stability for more rapid dissemination of fuel cells [ 9].
